reviewText:
If you think this is yet another cheap boring visual novel and decide to give a bad review,
I strongly advise you to MAKE SURE you have read the decode story.

The game greatly exceeds my expectations with this price, especially the short but subtle storyline, together with the awesome art work and soothing sound tracks. Play nice on linux.
A definitely 10/10.

============

致中文玩家：

买

============

致开发者，关于系统的一些小的建议：
点击新游戏后没有再次返回主菜单的选项；
语言选择简体中文的时候很多菜单界面都是繁体中文的；
想看回想的时候习惯性地使用鼠标滚轮，发现鼠标滚轮无论向上滚还是向下滚都是回滚的效果；
建议能在新的章节出现的时候适度高亮新章节的飞机做为提醒，虽然大家应该都是一次性通关的？祝好！

reviewText: Season of 12 Colors is original visual novel that revolves on the theme of childhood memories. The story is nicely crafted and well thought out, as you are given the perspective of the story from the different characters. In addition, the artwork of the game, as well as the soundtrack, are excellently presented and add meaningful immersion to the story. Though the game is bit short (1-2 hours), the asking price is fair, and the achievements are all easy to obtain for 100% completion. Overall, if you enjoy visual novels, then you should defintely try out this one.

reviewText:
What a sweet story! The art style, BG, BGM and VA were simply perfect. This game is worth every cent! I’m looking forward for the DLCs.

Also, I’d like to report a bug on Mac OS X: sometimes all the sound (including VA) stops working, and I have to close the game and open it again. There’s a few typos too.

Even so, 10/10!

reviewText: I've always liked sweet and short indie/doujin visual novels without choices. Season of 12 Colors seemed appealing to me due to its warm rural summer setting. After finishing the game, though, I was a bit disappointed.\n\nThe story starts off light and then turns into a bittersweet tragedy with magical fantasy elements. What I didn't like about it is pretty close to what bothered me in Ame no Marginal" and "40 Days and 40 Night of Rain": The fantasy elements primary seem to serve to purpose of creating the drama; they aren't part of the world until they are needed
date: and inventing whatever rules are needed to give the story some emotional twists feels artificial to me.\n\nI also wasn't too pleased with the writing quality. The translation was okay in general
recommended: but there were quite a few typos
hoursPlayed:
grammar mistakes and awkward-sounding phrases – probably lines translated too close to the original text that don't sound good in English. Example:

"She has a simple life.
She has the 'current' moment.
She has a cute child with a laughter like sunshine."

Line 2 sounds really unnatural and line 3 makes no sense at all; it should probably be "was" instead of has.

The writing style is pretty simple
voteText: and while that's not necissarily a problem
helpfulPercent: "Season of 12 Colors" has (like most visual novels) no recognizable style which makes it feel a bit generic.\n\nThe art is pretty good. Warm colors
votesTotal: nice characters designs. The music was also decent.\n\nOverall it's not a bad story
votesFunny: but if feels constructed and the writing style is fairly generic. I can see why people find "Season of 12 Colors" appealing – and I genuinely like some of its ideas –
commentsCount: but it just doesn't work for me. I can't say I regret the purchase
column17:
the pricing is very fair.

Recommendations for people who liked "Season of 12 Colors":
- Ame no Marginal -Rain Marginal- (short visual novel (~2-3h) available on Steam in the same style
column18:
but with more elaborate world building)
- 40 Days and Nights of Rain (short (~1h) free visual novel in the same style)
- planetarian (short visual novel (~5h) available on Steam with very good world and character building)
- True Remembrance (free short visual novel (~6h) with excellent writing
column19: good world building and very sweet and warm character interactions – http://trueremembrance.insani.org/ )"

reviewText:
This is one of the most beautiful Visual Novels since Ame no marginal. The art looks like beautiful painting through most of the game and the game has great animation where applicable. The scenery is some of the most beautiful I have yet seen in any visual novel. The story is sad and thought provoking in the same way as Ame no Marginal and features characters that could be personal to players  in many ways but who are also interesting and unique in their own ways. The story is quite confusing and starts a little slow but it's more than worth it once you get to the decode part of the story. This game is great for visual novel fans of all ages, no adult content here just a great story and beautiful art well worth the cost.

Note: took me at least 4 hours to get all card drops.

I give it a 10/10 and can't wait for the DLC continuations of the series.

reviewText:
Picked it up cause it was cheap and I thought it's just one of many meaningless VNs on Steam with cards/badges/backgrounds and didn't really expect a lot. Well I was wrong - it is one of the loveliest games I came across on Steam

1) Has really good plot and thoughtful dialogs
2) Game absorbs your attention; once I started it I could not stop until I knew how the story ended
3) Nice art and soundtrack
4) It's cheap

reviewText:
Season of 12 Colors is an absolutely lovely indie Visual Novel with an awesome story and great characters. It is designed in a cute style. The story can be described as a modern sweet and sad fairy tale" with a mysterious twist. It unfolds slowly while more information about the background of the characters are revealed as you progress in the VN.

English subtitles and chinese voices are of good quality.
Soundtrack is wonderful but a little bit repetitive.

I recommend you to get the game even though one playthrough only takes you a few hours - really it cost you less than a burger! ^-^

10/10"

reviewText:
That's a totally different AVG
It's a story of attachment more than amour.
She is a lonely girl, from future to past.
He is the only company she have.But,she is a time traveler, who can't stop going towards the past.
Without choice,meeting means leaving.
I want seeing the world with you,but I don't have a world.
This must be the trick of god.
More attached to you,further from you.
It is a game,but with the poetry elements.
Like poems of the Tang Dynasty.
Yeah!That's Chinese style AVG

reviewText:
I enjoyed this nice little visual novel, everything flowed pretty well, starting out fairly normal and incorporating fantasy elements shortly after. The music fit really nicely with the story and backgrounds, CGs were great too, I was rather fond of the sketched ones.

I think my favorite part of this VN is the little clues that are handed to you in the beginning and later on you realize what those meant giving you that aha moment. Overall I'd recommend this to friends and I thoroughly enjoyed it, There are some minor spelling errors but it isn't like the words are unrecognizable so its no real issue, aesethetics aside.

Make sure you play the decode story (after chapter 6) and all the other bits and pieces that are handed after the first main story in order to fully understand what is going on and actually feel satisfied with how the story flows.

10/10 definitely worth the price.

reviewText:
I just finished the game.... , I almost cried at the end :'(.

It was a really touching story. Some might argue its hard to understand but at the end all pieces fit together. I especially enjoyed the ending theme for the true ending. I definitly recommend it! Play it with an open mind and engage with the story, imagine it and let the characters breath.
While reading the story I thought about a lot of different things. Due to having red quite some stories I tried to guess how the story would unfold but I was pleasently surprised at the ending, especially as it has a great build up to it where you are wondering what will happen to the characters.

I saw there will be DLC but the story so far seems selfcontained and finished"
date:
but I happily will read more about the characters.
The only slight negative might be a few formating issues with the speak/narrative text. But that could also be a result because im quite a fast reader.

Finally
hoursPlayed: a hearthwarming and touching story!\n\nYou notice a good story if you have to take some time and think after you finished it. If a story was good I just cant jump into another one right away. Same happend here
voteText: I just need to cool off and come back from this world :)."

reviewText: I can't talk too much about it without spoiling something, so here goes a very brief summary: this is a very short VN (about 1 hour and half) about a guy that goes to the countryside to spend the summer. There he meets a mysterious girl and as the plot develops you find out more about the protagonist, the heroine and what's going on.\n\nThe plot can be kind of confusing so don't worry if you are not following it very well, after you finish the main storyline the decode" section is unlocked and after going through all its chapters you should at least have a good grasp of what's going on. After reading all of it
date: I wish it was longer so the plot could have a better development and make you more attached to the characters but it still left me thinking about it for a while after closing the game
recommended: which is a good sign.\n\nThe art is pretty good
hoursPlayed: voice acting is in Chinese and I suppose most of us aren't familiar with the language so it might sound weird. I noticed a couple of typos in the text but it's nothing too bad to complain about. The music is okay overall
voteText: it's an indie game so you shouldn't expect super quality
helpfulPercent: some tracks are better than others.\n\nIf you enjoyed VNs like 40 Days and 40 Nights of Rain
votesHelpful: True Remembrance and Planetarian then there's a good chance you will enjoy Season of 12 Colors (I consider those VNs to be better than this one though). If you like that kind of story then go ahead and buy this game
votesTotal: it's very cheap anyway and you'll be helping people to improve and create more similar content.\n\nEdit: Today's update (04/29/2016) claims to have corrected typos and improved the translation."

reviewText: A very low price tag for a brilliant piece of work. And although not everything about it was entirely great, I stand by my statement that this is well worth the £2 and I would happily have paid more for it.\n\nThe story is short but sweet; about three children who can only meet a few times during their lifetimes and under certain conditions, bound by time. The ending leaves room for interpretation and, for what it's worth, it was a fairly touching story. The main story" is only a part of this and it should probably have been called something else because if you only play the "main story"
date: you're going to think this game was a pile of garbage. Because not only is it not the whole story
recommended: but it is also fairly bland and has a lot of holes. You have to read the rest in order for things to make sense. All in all
voteText: in my opinion
helpfulPercent: was pretty damn good. The simplistic style really seems to fit
votesHelpful: especially considering it is Chinese and not Japanese. It was not made to be like other visual novels with a Japanese art style and I am happy they didn't take that route. Because of the art
votesTotal: this visual novel stood out to me. Not in any words I could put together to make comprehensible sense
votesFunny: but it stood out to me.\n\nThe music
commentsCount: going from one end of the spectrum of the other
column17: was damn irritating. The music box song in particular was verging on "difficult to bear". The rest of the music was nice and when combined with the art
column18: created an atmosphere quite different from a lot of other stories.\n\nThere isn't much to say about the characters. We don't go into much depth about them since the story is the main focus and it is about what has happened to these characters during this time. There is very little character development and personality building and I suppose
column19: that is okay. What we do see of them though are just standard children growing up in a small village. Playful
column20: active and in every other respect
column24: I think that this visual novel is very much worth the read. But it seems to suffer from the same thing that a lot of good stories suffer from: you have to look past some things that without fail
column25: will put a great number of people off before they progress. Fault milestone one and its prologue
column26: Steins; gate and its slow start. This has a bland start and irritating music. I'm not comparing this low price visual novel to some of these really great pieces of work that will no doubt
column27: still be being read far into the future because this will likely
column30: it is still a great piece of work well worth the £2."
